news_app.admin module¶

class news_app.admin.CustomUserAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]¶

Bases: UserAdmin

Admin configuration for the CustomUser model. Extends Django’s built-in UserAdmin to display extra fields such as ‘role’.

list_display = ['username', 'email', 'role', 'is_staff']¶
property media¶
model¶

alias of CustomUser

news_app.api_urls module¶

api_urls.py

Defines the API endpoints for the News App using Django REST Framework.

Endpoints: - /articles/ : List all approved and published articles - /articles/<id>/ : Retrieve details of a specific approved and published article - /drafts/ : List all drafts belonging to the logged-in journalist - /drafts/create/ : Create a new draft (journalists only) - /drafts/<id>/ : Update or delete a specific draft - /publishers/<id>/articles/ : List all approved and published articles under a specific publisher

news_app.api_views module¶

api_views.py

Defines API views for Articles in the News App using Django REST Framework.

Views: - ArticleListView: List all approved and published articles. - ArticleDetailView: Retrieve details of a single approved and published article. - DraftListView: List all drafts belonging to the logged-in journalist. - DraftCreateView: Create a new draft article. - DraftUpdateView: Update or delete a journalist’s own draft. - PublisherArticleListView: List all approved and published articles for a specific publisher.

news_app.models module¶

models.py

Defines the data models for the News App.

Models: - CustomUser: Extends AbstractUser with roles (Reader, Journalist, Editor, Publisher) - Publisher: Represents a publishing organization with members - Article: Represents articles written by journalists and managed by editors/publishers - Newsletter: Represents newsletters sent by journalists to readers

class news_app.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Article model representing a news article written by a journalist. Can belong to a publisher, be approved, published, or saved as a draft.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

can_publish(user)[source]¶

Determine if a given user can publish this article. Editors can publish if they belong to the same publisher. Publishers can always publish articles under their organization. Independent journalists can publish their own articles.

content¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class news_app.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model with roles: - Reader: subscribes to publishers/journalists - Journalist: writes articles & newsletters - Editor: approves articles (and can publish if part of a publisher) - Publisher: manages a team of journalists/editors

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('publisher', 'Publisher')]¶
articles¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

news_app.serializers module¶

serializers.py

This module defines Django REST Framework serializers for the News App.

  • ArticleSerializer: Serializes Article model fields for API endpoints.

  • PublisherSerializer: Serializes Publisher model fields for API endpoints.

  • NewsletterSerializer: Serializes Newsletter model fields for API endpoints.

class news_app.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Article model, used in API endpoints.

news_app.signals module¶

signals.py

This module defines Django signal handlers for the News App:

  • create_default_groups: Ensures that default user groups and permissions exist after migrations.

  • notify_article_approved: Sends email notifications to journalists when their articles are approved.

news_app.signals.create_default_groups(sender, **kwargs)[source]¶

Ensure default groups and permissions always exist after migrations. Runs only for this app (news_app).

news_app.signals.notify_article_approved(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]¶

Notify the journalist when their article is approved. Only fires when an existing article changes to approved=True.

news_app.tests module¶

tests.py

This module contains automated tests for the News App, including: - User role permissions (reader, journalist, editor, publisher) - Article CRUD operations (create, edit, delete) - Article approval and publishing - API endpoints for articles and drafts

class news_app.tests.ArticleAPITest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: TestCase

TestCase for verifying News App functionality: - Set up test data for groups, users, publisher, and articles - Test permissions for creating, editing, deleting, approving, and publishing articles - Test API endpoints for listing and retrieving articles

news_app.urls module¶

urls.py

This module defines all URL patterns for the News App, including: - Public views (article list and detail) - Journalist actions (create, edit, delete articles) - Editor actions (approve articles) - Publisher actions (publish articles) - User authentication (register, login, logout) - Dashboard - API endpoints

news_app.views module¶

views.py

This module contains all the view functions for the News App, including: - User registration and authentication - Dashboard views based on user roles - Article CRUD operations (create, edit, delete) - Article approval and publishing workflows - Public views for listing and viewing articles - API endpoints for retrieving articles

news_app.views.api_article_detail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

API endpoint to retrieve a single approved and published article.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Response: Serialized article data.

news_app.views.api_articles(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

API endpoint to list all approved and published articles.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Response: Serialized list of articles.

news_app.views.article_approve(request, pk)[source]¶

Approve an article. Only editors can approve articles of their publisher.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect: Redirects to dashboard.

news_app.views.article_delete(request, pk)[source]¶

Delete an article. Only the author or editor can delete.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders delete confirmation page or redirects on success.

news_app.views.article_detail(request, pk)[source]¶

Display a single article. Readers cannot view unpublished articles.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders article detail page.

news_app.views.article_edit(request, pk)[source]¶

Edit an existing article. Only the author or editor can edit.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders the article update page or redirects on success.

news_app.views.article_list(request)[source]¶

Display a list of approved and published articles.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders article list page.

news_app.views.article_publish(request, pk)[source]¶

Publish an article. Editors or publishers can publish articles for their publishers. Independent journalists can publish their own articles.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect: Redirects to dashboard.

news_app.views.create_article(request)[source]¶

Create a new article by a journalist.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders the article creation page or redirects to dashboard.

news_app.views.dashboard(request)[source]¶

Display the dashboard page according to the user’s role.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: Renders the dashboard template with user-specific data.

news_app.views.publish_independent_article(request, pk)[source]¶

Publish an independent article by its authoring journalist.

Args:

request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object. pk (int): Primary key of the article.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect: Redirects to dashboard.
